subject: Leadership
title: Social Loafing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Social Loafing.

hook.text: A team of ten works on a project. Three people do 80% of the work. The rest coast. Everyone gets equal credit.

buildup.text: Social loafing: people exert less effort in groups than alone. As group size increases, individual effort decreases.

discovery.text: Ringelmann's rope experiment: each person pulled less as teams grew. Eight people pulled at half their solo capacity.

twist.text: It's not laziness. It's anonymity. When individual contribution is invisible, the brain downshifts automatically.

climax.text: Counter it: make individual contributions visible, keep teams small, and ensure each role has clear accountability.

punchline.text: Nobody loafs when the spotlight is on.

quiz.question: What causes social loafing?
options: Individual contributions become invisible in groups
